thread.title: Waukegan police: Man stabbed multiple times in attack inside McDonald's
thread.title_full: Waukegan police: Man stabbed multiple times in attack inside McDonald's

author: Luke Hammill
title: Waukegan police: Man stabbed multiple times in attack inside McDonald's
text:
Waukegan police: Man stabbed multiple times in attack inside McDonald's Surveillance photo of stabbing suspect Waukegan Police Department 
Waukegan police released this photo of a suspect in a stabbing reported at the McDonald's in the 300 block of North Sheridan Road on Feb. 10. 
Waukegan police released this photo of a suspect in a stabbing reported at the McDonald's in the 300 block of North Sheridan Road on Feb. 10. (Waukegan Police Department) Privacy Policy 
A man was reportedly stabbed at a McDonald's in the 300 block of North Sheridan Road in Waukegan on Friday morning, according to Waukegan police. 
Officers responded to a call reporting the stabbing about 11:55 a.m., police said. Numerous witnesses told police that a man entered the McDonald's and stabbed the victim, a man in his 50s, multiple times in his body, authorities said. The victim was taken to a local hospital to be treated for his injuries, which police said do not appear to be life-threatening. 
The suspect was described as wearing a blue jacket and black shorts and covering his face with "some type of black mask," police said, adding that the suspect appeared to be white. He was last seen leaving the area in a blue sedan. 
"The motivation for this crime is not known and there appears to be no relationship between the suspect and victim," Waukegan police said in a news release. 
Officials ask anyone with information on the incident to call the Waukegan Police Department's tip line at 847-360-9001.
